raw: * A wrapper around Sinon.JS's FakeXMLHttpRequest and FakeServer features that
* allows quick and simple configuration of mock HTTP backends for testing and
* Automatically creates URL filtering rules to ensure that only configured
* requests are faked while others will be processed normally by the browser's

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A wrapper around Sinon.JS's FakeXMLHttpRequest and FakeServer features that allows quick and simple configuration of mock HTTP backends for testing and development. Automatically creates URL filtering rules to ensure that only configured requests are faked while others will be processed normally by the browser's XHR implementation.

raw: * Configures a set of fake HTTP responses. Each response is defined as a map
* that must provide the following keys:

*
  • method HTTP method to respond to, e.g. PUT

*
  • url URL used to match requests to fake responses. Can be
*   a RegExp or a String. REST-style parameter placeholders in curly braces
*   will be replaced with wildcards, e.g. the string "/resource/{resourceId}"

*
  • a string: This will be the response body, status code will be 200
*       <li>an array containing the status code, a map of response headers and
*       <li>a function: This will be called with a FakeXMLHttpRequest object as
* the only argument. Its respond method must be called to send a response.
* @param responseData {Map[]} An array of response description maps.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Configures a set of fake HTTP responses. Each response is defined as a map that must provide the following keys:

  • method HTTP method to respond to, e.g. PUT
  • url URL used to match requests to fake responses. Can be a RegExp or a String. REST-style parameter placeholders in curly braces will be replaced with wildcards, e.g. the string "/resource/{resourceId}" is interpreted as the RegExp /\/resource\/\{.*?\}/
  • response This can be either:
    • a string: This will be the response body, status code will be 200
    • an array containing the status code, a map of response headers and the response text, e.g. [200, { "Content-Type": "text/html" }, "OK"]
    • a function: This will be called with a FakeXMLHttpRequest object as the only argument. Its respond method must be called to send a response. See Sinon.JS: Respond for details.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: responseData {Map[]} An array of response description maps.
@param.description: An array of response description maps.

raw: * Removes a response that was configured with {@link #configure}
* @param method {String} HTTP method of the response

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes a response that was configured with {@link #configure}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: method {String} HTTP method of the response

raw: * Adds a URL filtering function to decide whether a request should be handled
* by the FakeServer or passed to the regular XMLHttp implementation.
* @param filter {Function} URL filter function. Will be called with the
* if the request should not be faked.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a URL filtering function to decide whether a request should be handled by the FakeServer or passed to the regular XMLHttp implementation. See Sinon.JS: Filtered Requests for details.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: filter {Function} URL filter function. Will be called with the following arguments: method, url, async, username, password. Must return true if the request should not be faked.
@param.description: URL filter function. Will be called with the following arguments: method, url, async, username, password. Must return true if the request should not be faked.

raw: * Remove a filter that was added with {@link #addFilter}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove a filter that was added with {@link #addFilter}

raw: * Defines a fake XHR response to a matching request.
* @param method {String} HTTP method to respond to, e.g. "GET"
* @param urlRegExp {RegExp} Request URL must match match this expression

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Defines a fake XHR response to a matching request.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: method {String} HTTP method to respond to, e.g. "GET"
@param.description: HTTP method to respond to, e.g. "GET"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: urlRegExp {RegExp} Request URL must match match this expression
@param.description: Request URL must match match this expression

@param.name: @param
@param.body: response {Function|Array|String} Response to send. See Sinon.JS: Fake Server for details.
@param.description: Response to send. See Sinon.JS: Fake Server for details.

raw: * Creates and configures a FakeServer if necessary and returns it.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and configures a FakeServer if necessary and returns it.

raw: * Stops the FakeServer and removes all configured responses and/or filters.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops the FakeServer and removes all configured responses and/or filters.
